text: Merle Ronald Haggard (April 6, 1937 - April 6, 2016) was an American country music singer and songwriter. He was known for his song "Okie from Muskogee". He was inducted into the Oklahoma Music Hall of Fame. He was involved with the growing outlaw country movement in the 1970s. Haggard won three Grammy Awards. On April 6, 2016, Haggard died at his home in Palo Cedro, California from complications from pneumonia. He was 79 years old. ==Discography== ===Singles=== *"Okie from Muskogee" (1969) ===Studio albums=== *Strangers (1965) *Just Between the Two of Us (1966) *Swinging Doors (1966) *I'm a Lonesome Fugitive
